page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content:
There are patches of waste land round the back of St. John's, near Clammerclough Road, Lark Hill and Primrose Street. In some places, especially near St.John's School where houses have been demolished the land has been grassed and trees planted. A long seat has been put near Gerrard St.on a new grassy mound. A children's playground with swings, climbing frame, grass and bushes has been built on waste land at the end of Lord Street.
New Park is a large area of land overlooking the river Irwell. It has been planted with deciduous and evergreen trees and contains rabbits, foxes and all sorts of birds and butterflies. The ferns of Farnworth also grow here. Some can be found in St. John's school grounds.
